page.title: 10Changing times in Rawmarsh
page.content: Mr Simmonite was a miner for 51 years. In his early days coal tubs were moved by ponies and men called 'trammers'. As a boy he could only work mornings and afternoons until the age of 16 when he could work three shifts of 7 hours. During the{General Strike}of 1926 he was off work for six months with no income but spent his time walking all the local footpaths. The only trouble he caused was to take a turnip from a farmer's field! Mr Simmonite was a{Scout leader}at the Parish Church from 1940 until 1975. There were about 25-30 scouts in his troop which won several First Aid competitions in the local district. Mr Simmonite thinks life is better today in some respects but regrets the loss of the old community feeling when people always helped someone in need.
